education.degree: Full-time PhD in Human-Computer Interaction - SFI D-real
education.research_topic: Empowering older adults to engage with their own health data using multimodal feedback
education.description: Currently exploring the accessibility and usability challenges facing older adults when using sensor devices and investigating new ways to convey physiological sensing data to engage them in improving their own health.

education.degree: Master of Science Advanced Computer Science (Distinction, First class Honours)
education.research_project: Verifying user interfaces with Spark Ada, a case study for the T35 syringe pump
education.description: Collaborated with peers on identifying relevant interactive systems problems, performed comparative solutions analysis for hand therapy, and developed an embodied prototype for non-assisted therapy, reducing the need for a carer.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

publications.title: Lost in Data: How Older Adults Perceive and Navigate Health Data Representations
publications.authors: Jean, Peterson; Murphy, Emma; Bates, Enda

publications.title: Learning from each other: An inclusive and reflexive analysis of the experiences of co-designers with intellectual disabilities
publications.authors: Murphy, Emma; Fitzgerald, Patrick; Badmos, Fatima; Jean, Peterson; Gilligan, John; O'Sullivan, Dympna; Boland, Sarah
publications.venue: Technology for Inclusion and Participation for All: Recent Achievements and Future Directions

publications.title: “What does THIS Mean?”: A Collaborative Expert Evaluation of Health Data Representations for Older Adults
publications.authors: Jean, P.; Murphy, E.; Bates, E.
publications.venue: Computers Helping People with Special Needs (ICCHP 2024), Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol. 14751

publications.title: Accessibility of Health Data Representations for Older Adults: Challenges and Opportunities for Design
publications.authors: Jean, P.; Murphy, E.; Bates, E.
publications.venue: HCI International 2023 Posters (HCII 2023), Communications in Computer and Information Science, vol. 1833

certifications.description: Completed the Executive Education program for world-class leaders and nonprofit managers to tackle challenging social problems hosted by Thunderbird School of Global Management.

workExperience.company: Technological University Dublin - School of Surveying and Construction Innovation
workExperience.description: Teach 2 hours weekly of web development to second-year Construction and Surveying students.
topics_covered: Evolution of HTML and web technologies
Web Design and Styling (Basic Colour Theory, CSS, Typography)
Code management and principles (DRY Method, GIT, GitHub)
Server Deployment (cloud deployment with Vercel and Git)

workExperience.company: Technological University Dublin - School of Computer Science
workExperience.description: Conduct lab demonstrations, provide feedback and assess students across several modules.

workExperience.company: Technological University Dublin - School of Humanities
workExperience.position: Hourly-Paid Assistant Lecturer - Computer Science Fundamentals
workExperience.description: Taught and designed course content on the International Foundation Programme, exposing students to the breadth of computer science as they transition towards their chosen degree.

workExperience.company: Global Innovation Teams - School of Computer Science, TU Dublin
workExperience.description: Mentored two groups of students (10+) from different schools interning with an industry partner in their human-centred technology-driven solutions.
responsibilities: Supported projects on women's transportation safety in private transportation.
Supported interactive video content creation for kids with dyslexia through storytelling.
Helped students translate human-centred design into a manageable scrum timeline.

workExperience.description: Completed a research internship as part of the ACCESS2CS consortium.
responsibilities: Led a systematic literature review on accessible teaching methods in computer science, including search strategy, criteria definition, and inclusion review.
Collaborated with partners across the consortium to synthesise and report findings.

workExperience.description: Worked with a team of front-end developers on government digital information compliance software to monitor and report mobile money fraudulent activities.
responsibilities: Conducted user research and matched user stories to tailor needs in challenging areas where connectivity and performance optimisation are critical.
Determined functional solutions that reduced development costs.
Translated prototypes into reusable Vue.js web features.
Trained new hires on daily operations to support team productivity.

workExperience.description: Managed IT operations for staff and students across Haiti and New York.
responsibilities: Oversaw activities of the IT unit serving 45+ staff and 104+ students in Haiti and New York offices.
Participated in the development of a student information system with CiviCRM integration in collaboration with Openflows, an open-source technology company.
Integrated core services to optimise scholar recruitment, student and staff management, and administrative process data.
Advised on online strategies to reach disadvantaged areas using database analytics, resulting in an online application prototype enabling rural applicants to apply for scholarships.
Built automated reports in the student information system to support research on HELP Education impact assessment in Haiti.

service_and_engagement.description: Facilitated workshops with older adults on AI awareness as part of Ireland's National Artificial Intelligence Literacy Initiative in four counties; ran and demonstrated AI interaction artefacts at events for older adult attendees.

Assisted students and co-designers with intellectual disabilities from Saint John of God as part of a software engineering project jointly developed with lecturers at the School of Computer Science; facilitated workshops with co-designers and industry partners to capture lived experiences and co-create human-centred solutions.

Served as international officer to support inclusive integration of international students across campuses; liaised with Chaplaincy to organise service activities during Remembrance Week for Grangegorman residents and students.

service_and_engagement.organization: CHAT – Community Hub for Accessible Technology
service_and_engagement.description: Volunteer supporting organisers and attendees at regular meetings; extended research impact beyond campus into specialised accessibility and assistive technology networks.

service_and_engagement.organization: Irish Human Factors and Ergonomics Society (IHFES)
service_and_engagement.description: Active student member; participated and presented at the annual IHFES 2023 conference.

extracurricular_activities.organization: Irish Human Factors and Ergonomics Society (IHFES)
extracurricular_activities.description: Active student member, participated and presented at the annual IHFES 2023 conference.

extracurricular_activities.organization: CHAT – Community Hub for Accessible Technology
extracurricular_activities.description: Volunteer at regular CHAT meetings, supporting organisers and attendees.
International officer responsible for inclusive integration of international students in events across all campuses.
Participated in the competition to gain exposure to industry challenges.

awards.title: ResearchIreland Full-time 4-year PhD Studentship
awards.organization: SFI Centre for Research Training in Digitally-Enhanced Reality (d-real)
awards.description: Awarded a fully-funded 4-year PhD scholarship (tuition fees plus annual stipend).

awards.title: Chevening Scholar
awards.description: Recipient of the prestigious fully-funded Chevening Master’s scholarship (tuition fees plus living stipend).

awards.title: HELP Scholar
awards.description: Recipient of a merit- and needs-based undergraduate scholarship awarded to academically excellent and community-engaged high school students.

news.description: Delivered talk: CAPE: Interaction multimodale pour aider les personnes âgées à mieux utiliser leurs données de santé at “Ma Thèse en 180 secondes”, University of Galway.
Presented Beyond Numbers: Making Sense of Health Data Representation at the tPot Symposium, TU Dublin
Presented “Significance in Signs?”: Beyond Conventional Health Data Representations for Older Adults at the Annual Research Symposium, Faculty of Computing.
Gave talk Enhancing Health Data Representation for Older Adults: A Search for Evidence at the Irish Human Factors and Ergonomics Society annual symposium.
Gave a talk to the U3A at the Ballymun Library, Ireland
Gave a talk on Semantic Preferences in Health Data Representation to LBI for Digital Health and Prevention
Presented our paper at Pervasive Health 2025
Presented our position paper at BCSHCI2025 codesign4AI workshop
Published an opinion piece on RTÉ brainstorm
Chaired the interactive presentation session at Accessibility in Action (TU Dublin)
